DataElement.preferredName: Lymph Node Involved Largest Nodal Mass Length 1 Decimal Place Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric value to express the length of the largest lymph nodal mass.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Small, bean-shaped organs located along the channels of the lymphatic system. The lymph nodes store special cells that can trap bacteria or cancer cells traveling through the body in lymph. Clusters of lymph nodes are found in the underarms, groin, neck, chest, and abdomen. Also called lymph glands.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Largest Nodal Mass Length 1 Decimal Place Measurement
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Greatest in size of those under consideration._Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part._A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes._The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Largest Nodal Mass Length Integer::1 Decimal Place Measurement
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Greatest in size of those under consideration.:Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.:A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.:The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in size of those under consideration.
Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
